optionalfeature.name: Arcane Propulsion Armor
entries: The wearer of this armor gains these benefits:

items: The wearer's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 5 feet.

The armor includes gauntlets, each of which is a magic melee weapon that can be wielded only when the hand is holding nothing. The wearer is {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with the gauntlets, and each one deals {@damage 1d8} force damage on a hit and has the thrown property, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When thrown, the gauntlet detaches and flies at the attack's target, then immediately returns to the wearer and reattaches.
The armor can't be removed against the wearer's will.
If the wearer is missing any limbs, the armor replaces those limbs—hands, arms, feet, legs, or similar appendages. The replacements function identically to the body parts they replace.

optionalfeature.name: Armor of Magical Strength
entries: This armor has 6 charges. The wearer can expend the armor's charges in the following ways:

items: When the wearer makes a Strength check or a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, it can expend 1 charge to add a bonus to the roll equal to its Intelligence modifier.
If the creature would be knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}, it can use its {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend 1 charge to avoid being knocked prone.

entries: The armor regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Boots of the Winding Path
entries: While wearing these boots, a creature can teleport up to 15 feet as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to an unoccupied space the creature can see. The creature must have occupied that space at some point during the current turn.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Arcane Focus

item: A rod, staff, or wand (requires attunement)

entries: While holding this item, a creature gains a +1 bonus to spell {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and to its Spell Save DC.
The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class. This bonus is subject to the enhancement bonus limit from items.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Defense

item: A suit of armor or a shield

entries: A creature gains a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wearing (armor) or wielding (shield) the infused item.
The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class. This bonus is subject to the enhancement bonus limit from items.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Weapon
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.
The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class. This bonus is subject to the enhancement bonus limit from items.

optionalfeature.name: Helm of Awareness
entries: While wearing this helmet, a creature has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on initiative rolls. In addition, the wearer can't be {@condition Surprised|Ishiir}, provided it isn't {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Homunculus Servant

item: A gem or crystal worth at least 100 gp

entries: You learn intricate methods for magically creating a special {@creature Homunculus Servant|TCE|homunculus} that serves you. The item you infuse serves as the creature's heart, around which the creature's body instantly forms.
You determine the homunculus's appearance. Some artificers prefer mechanical-looking birds, whereas some like winged vials or miniature, animate cauldrons.

The homunculus is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the Homunculus Servant stat block, which uses your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus (PB) in several places.

In combat, the homunculus shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge|Ishiir} action, unless you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, the homunculus can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge|Ishiir}.
The homunculus regains {@dice 2d6} hit points if the {@spell Mending|Ishiir} spell is cast on it. If you or the homunculus dies, it vanishes, leaving its heart in its space.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Sharpener

item: A suit of armor or robes

entries: The infused item can send a jolt to the wearer to refocus their mind. The item has 4 charges. When the wearer fails a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} to maintain {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on a spell, the wearer can use its {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend 1 of the item's charges to succeed instead. The item regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Weapon

item: A simple or martial weapon (requires attunement)

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. This bonus is subject to the enhancement bonus limit from items.

While holding it, the wielder can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to cause it to shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. The wielder can extinguish the light as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

The weapon has 4 charges. As a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} immediately after being hit by an attack, the wielder can expend 1 charge and cause the attacker to be {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} until the end of the attacker's next turn, unless the attacker succeeds on a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. The weapon regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Repeating Shot

item: A simple or martial weapon with the ammunition property (requires attunement)

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged attack, and it ignores the loading property if it has it. This bonus is subject to the enhancement bonus limit from items.

If the weapon lacks ammunition, it produces its own, automatically creating one piece of magic ammunition when the wielder makes a ranged attack with it. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target.

optionalfeature.name: Replicate Magic Item
entries: Using this infusion, you replicate a particular magic item. You can learn this infusion multiple times; each time you do so, choose a magic item that you can make with it, picking from the Replicable Items tables below. A table's title tells you the level you must be in the class to choose an item from the table. Alternatively, you can choose the magic item from among the {@filter common magic items|items|type=!potion;!scroll|rarity=common} in the game, not including potions or scrolls.

In the tables, an item's entry tells you whether the item requires attunement. See the item's description in the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG} for more information about it, including the type of object required for its making.

entries.caption: Replicable Items (14th-Level Artificer)
rows: {@item Belt of Hill Giant Strength||Belt of hill giant strength}

optionalfeature.name: Repulsion Shield
entries: A creature gains a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wielding this shield. This bonus is subject to the enhancement bonus limit from items.

The shield has 4 charges. While holding it, the wielder can use a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} immediately after being hit by a melee attack to expend 1 of the shield's charges and push the attacker up to 15 feet away. The shield regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Resistant Armor
entries: While wearing this armor, a creature has {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to one of the following damage types, which you choose when you infuse the item: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Returning Weapon

item: A simple or martial weapon with the thrown property

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it returns to the wielder's hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack. This bonus is subject to the enhancement bonus limit from items.

optionalfeature.name: Spell-Refueling Ring
entries: While wearing this ring, the creature can recover one expended spell slot as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. The recovered slot can be of 3rd level or lower. Once used, the ring can't be used again until the next dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Heavy
entries: While wearing this armor, you have a number of temporary hitpoints equal to 1.5 times its AC (rounded down), which stack with any other form of temporary hitpoints. You regain any lost temporary hitpoints from this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} by expending 1 gp per temporary hitpoint.

optionalfeature.name: Light
entries: While wearing this armor, you have a number of temporary hitpoints equal to its AC, which stack with any other form of temporary hitpoints. You regain any lost temporary hitpoints from this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} by expending 1 sp per temporary hitpoint.

optionalfeature.name: Medium
entries: While wearing this armor, you have a number of temporary hitpoints equal to its AC, which stack with any other form of temporary hitpoints. You regain any lost temporary hitpoints from this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} by expending 5 sp per temporary hitpoint.

optionalfeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While using your Unarmored Defense or similar permanent feature that alters the calculation for your AC, you have a number of temporary hitpoints equal to its AC, which stack with any other form of temporary hitpoints. You can regain any lost temporary hitpoints from this feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} by expending 5 sp per temporary hitpoint.

optionalfeature.name: Banishing Shot
entries: You use abjuration magic to try to temporarily banish your target to a harmless location in the Feywild. The creature hit by the projectile must also succeed on a Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be banished. While banished in this way, the target's speed is 0, and it is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the space it vacated or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
After you reach 18th level in this class, a target also takes {@damage 2d6} force damage when the projectile hits it.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Shot
entries: Your enchantment magic causes this projectile to temporarily beguile its target. The creature hit by the projectile takes an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage, and choose one of your allies within 30 feet of the target. The target must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, or it is {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} by the chosen ally until the start of your next turn. This effect ends early if the chosen ally attacks the {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} target, deals damage to it, or forces it to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}.
The psychic damage increases to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Bursting Shot
entries: You imbue your projectile with force energy drawn from the school of evocation. The energy detonates after your attack. Immediately after the projectile hits the creature, the target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take {@damage 2d6} force damage each.
The force damage increases to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Enfeebling Shot
entries: You weave necromantic magic into your projectile. The creature hit by the projectile takes an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, or the damage dealt by its weapon attacks is halved until the start of your next turn.
The necrotic damage increases to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Shot
entries: When this projectile strikes its target, conjuration magic creates grasping, poisonous brambles, which wrap around the target. The creature hit by the projectile takes an extra {@damage 2d6} poison damage, its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is reduced by 10 feet, and it takes {@damage 2d6} slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves 1 foot or more without teleporting. The target or any creature that can reach it can use its action to remove the brambles with a successful Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your Arcane Shot save DC. Otherwise, the brambles last for 1 minute or until you use this option again.
The poison damage and slashing damage both increase to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Shot
entries: You use transmutation magic to give your projectile an ethereal quality. When you use this option, you don't make an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} for the attack. Instead, the projectile shoots forward in a line, which is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The projectile passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, a creature takes damage as if it were hit by the projectile, plus an extra {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
The piercing damage increases to {@damage 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Shot
entries: Using divination magic, you grant your projectile the ability to seek out a target. When you use this option, you don't make an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} for the attack. Instead, choose one creature you have seen in the past minute. The projectile flies toward that creature, moving around corners if necessary and ignoring three-quarters cover and half cover. If the target is within the weapon's range and there is a path large enough for the projectile to travel to the target, the target must make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. Otherwise, the projectile disappears after traveling as far as it can. On a failed save, the target takes damage as if it were hit by the projectile, plus an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage, and you learn the target's current location. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and you don't learn its location.
The force damage increases to {@damage 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Shot
entries: You weave illusion magic into your projectile, causing it to occlude your foe's vision with shadows. The creature hit by the projectile takes an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage, and it must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be unable to see anything farther than 5 feet away until the start of your next turn.
The psychic damage increases to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Binding
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you attempt to bind a Large or smaller creature you can see within 30 feet of you, which must make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, the cursed creature's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is reduced to 0 and it can't use {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir|Reactions} until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: This curse lasts for 1 minute and can affect any creature regardless of size. The cursed creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Bloated Agony
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you curse a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you, causing its body to swell until the end of your next turn. For the duration, the creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on strength {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and Dexterity {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}, and takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage each time it makes an attack.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: This curse lasts for 1 minute. The cursed creature can make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Corrosion

otherSummary.entry: {@class Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Order of the Mutant|Order of the Mutant|Ishiir}

entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you deal acid damage equal to 2 x {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} to a creature you can see within 30 feet of you and reduce its AC by 2 until the start of your next turn. The target then has to make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, the target takes this damage again and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} and the AC reduction lasts until the end of its next turn. The cursed creature can make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the initial {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Exposure
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to temporarily weaken its resilience. Until the end of the target's next turn, it loses {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all the damage types dealt by the triggering effect (including for that triggering effect).

entries.name: Amplify
entries: This curse lasts for 1 minute. The cursed creature can make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Anxious
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you harry the body or mind of a creature you can see within 30 feet of you, making them susceptible to mental influence. Until the end of your next turn, Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} made against the cursed creature have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} and whenever the target takes psychic damage, it takes additional damage of the same type equal to a roll of your hemocraft die.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The next Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} the cursed creature makes before this curse ends has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Blackened Gaze
entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}, when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes a weapon attack, you can cause that attack to have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}. If the attack still hits, the target creature takes half damage from it. This curse has no effect on creatures that do not rely on sight or are otherwise {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} condition.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The target creature has to make a Constitution save or be {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Exorcist

otherSummary.entry: {@class Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Order of the Ghostslayer|Order of the Ghostslayer|Ishiir}

entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you that is {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}, or which is under a possession effect. The target creature is no longer {@condition Charmed|Ishiir}, {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}, or possessed.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: A creature that {@condition Charmed|Ishiir}, {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}, or possessed the target of your curse takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage and must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be {@condition Stunned|Ishiir} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Fallen Puppet
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you drops to 0 hit points, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to instill that creature with a final act of aggression. The creature immediately makes one weapon attack against a target of your choice within its range.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: You can first cause the cursed creature to move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, and you grant a bonus to its {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} equal to your Hemocraft modifier (minimum of +1).

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Howl

otherSummary.entry: {@class Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Order of the Lycan|Order of the Lycan|Ishiir}

entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you unleash a bloodcurdling howl. Each creature within 30 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} until the end of your next turn. You can choose any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by the howl.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The range of this curse increases to 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Infirm
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you weaken the health of a creature within 30 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, whenever the target takes poison or necrotic damage, it takes additional damage of the same type equal to a roll of your hemocraft die.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The next Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} the cursed creature makes before this curse ends has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Marked
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you mark a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. Until the end of your turn, whenever you hit the cursed creature with a weapon for which you have an active crimson rite, you roll an additional hemocraft die when determining the extra damage from the rite.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The next {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} you make against the target before the end of your turn has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Muddled Mind
entries: As a bonus action, you curse a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you that is {@condition Concentration|Ishiir|concentrating} on a spell or using a feature that requires {@condition Concentration|Ishiir}. The target has to make a Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, the affected creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom, Intelligence, and {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: This curse lasts for 1 minute. The cursed creature can make a Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success. You can choose any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by the howl.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Soul Eater

otherSummary.entry: {@class Blood Hunter|Ishiir|Order of the Profane Soul|Order of the Profane Soul|Ishiir}

entries: When a creature that isn't a construct or undead is reduced to 0 hit points within 30 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to offer their life energy to your patron in exchange for power. Until the end of your next turn, you make attacks with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} and you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: Additionally, you regain an expended warlock spell slot. Once you've amplified this blood curse, you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} before you can amplify it again.

optionalfeature.name: Breath of Winter
entries: You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell Cone of Cold|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Clench of the North Wind
entries: You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell Rime's Binding Ice|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: You can use your action to briefly control elemental forces within 30 feet of you, causing one of the following effects of your choice:

items: Create a harmless, instantaneous sensory effect related to air, earth, fire, or water, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, a spray of light mist, or a gentle rumbling of stone.
Instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
Chill or warm up to 1 pound of nonliving material for up to 1 hour.
Cause earth, fire, water, or mist that can fit within a 1-foot cube to shape itself into a crude form you designate for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Eternal Mountain Defense
entries: You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell Stoneskin|Ishiir}, targeting yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Fangs of the Fire Snake
entries: When you use the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki point to cause tendrils of flame to stretch out from your fists and feet. Your reach with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes} increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. A hit with such an attack deals fire damage instead of bludgeoning damage. If you spend 1 additional ki point when you use this feature, all {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes} until the start of your next turn also deal an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Fist of Four Thunders
entries: You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell Thunderwave|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Flames of the Phoenix
entries: You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell Fireball|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Gong of the Summit
entries: You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell Shatter|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Hand of Ore
entries: You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell Maximilian's Earthen Grasp|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Mist Stance
entries: You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell Gaseous Form|Ishiir}, targeting yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Ride the Wind
entries: You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell Fly|Ishiir}, targeting yourself.

optionalfeature.name: River of Hungry Flame
entries: You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell Wall of Fire|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Rush of the Gale Spirits
entries: You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell Gust of Wind|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Shape the Flowing River
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can spend 1 ki point to choose an area of ice or water no larger than 30 feet on a side within 120 feet of you. You can change water to ice within the area and vice versa, and you can reshape ice in the area in any manner you choose. You can raise or lower the ice's elevation, create or fill in a trench, erect or flatten a wall, or form a pillar. The extent of any such changes can't exceed half the area's largest dimension. For example, if you affect a 30-foot square, you can create a pillar up to 15 feet high. raise or lower the square's elevation by up to 15 feet, dig a trench up to 15 feet deep, and so on. You can't shape the ice to trap or injure a creature in the area.

optionalfeature.name: Sweeping Cinder Strike
entries: You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell Burning Hands|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Unbroken Air
entries: You can create a blast of compressed air that strikes like a mighty fist. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can spend 2 ki points and choose a creature within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage, plus an extra {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage for each additional ki point you spend, and you can push the creature up to 20 feet away from you and knock it {@condition Prone|Ishiir}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and you don't push it or knock it {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Water Whip
entries: You can spend 2 ki points as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to create a whip of water that shoves and pulls a creature to unbalance it. A creature that you can see that is within 30 feet of you must make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage, plus an extra {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage for each additional ki point you spend, and you can either knock it {@condition Prone|Ishiir} or pull it up to 25 feet closer to you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and you don't pull it or knock it {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Wave of Rolling Earth
entries: You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell Wall of Stone|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Aquatic Traits
entries: Increase one ability score of your Eidolon from among Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1.
Your Eidolon gains a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} if it doesn't already have one, equal to its highest {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} and it can breathe underwater.

optionalfeature.name: Breath Weapon
entries: Your Eidolon learns to exhale destructive energy. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, radiant, or thunder.
Additionally, choose the area shape that the Breath Weapon affects: 15 + 5 x {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} feet cone or 30 + 10 x {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} feet long, 5 feet wide line.

Your Eidolon can activate its Breath Weapon as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. Each creature in the area of effect has to make a DEX {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 4d6} + {@damage 1d6} x {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} of the chosen damage type on a failure and half as much on a success.
Once it has used its breath weapon it cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir} or you spend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Chamaeleon Hide
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Dexterity or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon can use its {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to become {@condition Invisible|Ishiir}. The invisibility ends if your Eidolon performs a hostile action.

optionalfeature.name: Damage Immunity
entries: When you are in Symbiosis with your Eidolon, you are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to every damage type you selected for Damage {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} evolution feat.

optionalfeature.name: Damage Resistance
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon gains {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, or radiant.
This evolution feat can be selected multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Eidolon Resilience
entries: Choose one ability score. Your Eidolon gains the following benefits:

items: Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon gains {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} using the chosen ability.

entries: This evolution feat can be selected multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Eidolon Toughness
entries: Your Eidolon's hitpoints increase by an amount equal to twice your summoner level.
This evolution feat can be selected multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Infusion
entries: Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, radiant, or thunder.
Your Eidolon's weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} of the chosen damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Physiology
entries: Increase one ability score of your Eidolon from among Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 2 or increase 2 ability scores from among those by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
This evolution feat can be selected multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Evasion
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.

If the Eidolon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, and only half damage if it fails.

optionalfeature.name: Fear Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to Eidolon that starts its turn within 20 feet of it or enters that area for the first time on a turn, must make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC, unless the Eidolon is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} until the start of its next turn. If a creature's {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} is successful, the creature is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the Eidolon's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Fierce Charge
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Once your turn, when your Eidolon moves towards a creature in a straight line for the first time, it can add 1 dmg for every 5 ft spent as part of that movement to the first melee weapon damage roll it makes against that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Grappling Attacks
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Creatures no more than one size larger than your Eidolon that are hit by your Eidolon's natural weapon attacks have to make a STR or DEX {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} (target creature's choice) against your spell save DC. On failure, the target creature is {@condition Grappled|Ishiir} by your Eidolon. Creatures that are the same size of the Eidolon or smaller, are also {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} while {@condition Grappled|Ishiir} in this manner.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Size Increase
entries: Your Eidolon's size increases to huge and its hitpoints increase by an amount equal to your summoner level.
Additionally, the reach of its melee weapon attacks increases by 5 feet and the die size for its natural weapons and damaging abilities increases by 1 step.

optionalfeature.name: Hardened Hide
entries: Your Eidolon's AC increases by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Skill
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your Eidolon learns one additional skill. If it is already {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in the skill, it adds double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} it makes with it.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Speed
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Intertwined Metabolism
entries: When you are in Symbiosis with your Eidolon, you are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} and {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir} conditions and to non-magical diseases. If you enter Symbiosis while any of the aforementioned are already affecting either you or your Eidolon or both, they are removed at the end of the same turn.

optionalfeature.name: Lacerating Attacks
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength or Dexterity by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Creatures hit by your Eidolon's natural weapon attacks have to make a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. On failure, the target creature is {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir}. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the condition on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Resistance
entries: When your Eidolon fails a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, it can choose to succeed instead.
Your Eidolon can use this feature three times and it regains all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Resistance (EF)
entries: The Eidolon has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spells and other magical effects.

optionalfeature.name: Pack Leader
entries: Creatures summoned by you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against any creatures that they can see within 5 feet of your Eidolon, unless your Eidolon is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, your Eidolon can gaze at a creature within 60 feet of it, causing it to gradually turn to stone. The target creature has to make a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. On a failed save, it is {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} as its flesh begins to harden. On a successful save, the creature isn't affected.

A creature restrained by this ability must make another Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this ability three times, the effect ends. If it fails its saves three times, it is turned to stone and subjected to the {@condition Petrified|Ishiir} condition for the duration. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.
If the creature is physically broken while petrified, it suffers from similar deformities if it reverts to its original state.
Once it has used its petrifying gaze it cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir} or you spend a spell slot of 5th level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Pounce
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength or Dexterity by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Once per turn, as part of a melee weapon attack, your Eidolon can move up to its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} in a straight line towards a target of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Ranged Attacks
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength or Dexterity by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your Eidolon gains a ranged natural weapon attack with a range of 80/320. The damage die of this attack is identical to its other natural attacks and uses the same ability score for attack and damage rolls.
You can choose the damage type of the ranged attack from one of the following: acid, bludgeoning, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, piercing, poison, radiant, slashing, or thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Regeneration
entries: Your Eidolon regenerates an amount of hitpoints equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} at the start of each of its turns.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: Your Eidolon gains {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Stealth} skill. If it is already {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in the skill, it adds double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} it makes with it.
While in dim light or darkness, your Eidolon can take the {@action Hide|Ishiir} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Shimmering Hide
entries: Your Eidolon projects a magical illusion that blurs its appearance to the naked eye and makes it difficult to tell its actual position and movements, causing {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against it to have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}. If it takes damage, this trait is disrupted until the start of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the Eidolon is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} or has a {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} of 0.

optionalfeature.name: Size Increase
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon's size increases to large and its hitpoints increase by an amount equal to your summoner level.

optionalfeature.name: Special Senses
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon gains one of the following senses of your choice:

items: {@sense Blindsight|PHB} within 30 feet.
{@sense Tremorsense|MM} within 60 feet.
{@optfeature Devil's Sight|Ishiir} within 120 feet.

entries: This evolution feat can be selected multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Subterranean Traits
entries: Increase one ability score of your Eidolon from among Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1.
Your Eidolon gains a {@variantrule Climb Speed|Ishiir} equal to its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} and a {@variantrule Burrow Speed|Ishiir} equal to half its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.
Additionally, the {@sense darkvision|PHB} range of your Eidolon increases to 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Toppling Attacks
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Creatures no more than one size larger than your Eidolon that are hit by your Eidolon's natural weapon attacks have to make a STR {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. On failure, the target creature is knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Unshakeable Devotion
entries: Your Eidolon is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} and {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Vanguard
entries: Whenever you a creature summoned by you that is within 20 feet of your Eidolon must make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, the creature gains a bonus to the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} equal to your choice of your Intelligence or Charisma modifier (with a minimum bonus of +1).

optionalfeature.name: Venomous Attacks
entries: Creatures hit by your Eidolon's natural weapon attacks have to make a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. On failure, the target creature is {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}. A poisoned creature takes poison damage equal to twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} at the start of each of its turns.
At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the condition on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Wings
entries: Your Eidolon gains a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} if it doesn't already have one, equal to its highest {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Agonizing Blast

otherSummary.entry: a Warlock cantrip that deals damage

entries: Choose one of your known Warlock cantrips that deals damage. You can add your Charisma modifier to that spell's damage rolls.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can gain this invocation more than once. Each time you do so, choose a different eligible cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Armor of Shadows
entries: You can cast {@spell Mage Armor|Ishiir} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Ascendant Step
entries: You can cast {@spell Levitate|Ishiir} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Aspect of the Moon
entries: You no longer need to sleep and can't be forced to sleep by any means. To gain the benefits of a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, you can spend all 8 hours doing light activity, such as reading your Book of Shadows and keeping watch.

optionalfeature.name: Beast Speech
entries: You can cast {@spell Speak with Animals|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Influence
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Deception} and {@skill Persuasion} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Bewitching Whispers
entries: You can cast {@spell Compulsion|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Bond of the Talisman
entries: While someone else is wearing your talisman, you can use your action to teleport to the unoccupied space closest to them, provided the two of you are on the same plane of existence. The wearer of your talisman can do the same thing, using their action to teleport to you. The teleportation can be used a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Book of Ancient Secrets
entries: You can now inscribe magical rituals in your Book of Shadows. Choose two {@filter 1st-level spells that have the ritual tag from any class's spell list|spells|Components & Miscellaneous=ritual|level=1|source=Ishiir}. The spells needn't be from the same spell list. The spells appear in the book and don't count against the number of spells you know. With your Book of Shadows in hand, you can cast the chosen spells as rituals. You can't cast the spells except as rituals, unless you've learned them by some other means. You can also cast a warlock spell you know as a ritual if it has the ritual tag.

On your adventures, you can add other ritual spells to your Book of Shadows. When you find such a spell, you can add it to the book if the spell's level is equal to or less than half your warlock level (rounded up) and if you can spare the time to transcribe the spell. For each level of the spell, the transcription process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp for the rare inks needed to inscribe it.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Hex
entries: When you apply your Hexblade's Curse to a creature, it also takes fire damage equal to your Warlock level + your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Caiphon's Beacon
entries: The purple star Caiphon is the doom of inexperienced mariners. Those who use its deceptive light to guide their travels invariably come to ruin. You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Deception} and {@skill Stealth} skills, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Chain Master's Fury
entries: When you command your familiar to attack, it makes one additional attack. Additionally, you add your Charisma modifier to your familiar's damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Chains of Carceri
entries: You can cast {@spell Hold Monster|Ishiir} at will—targeting a celestial, fiend, or elemental—without expending a spell slot or material components. You must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} before you can use this invocation on the same creature again.

optionalfeature.name: Chilling Hex
entries: When you apply your Hexblade's Curse to a creature, it and creatures within 5 feet of it also take cold damage equal to half your Warlock level + your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Chronicle of the Raven Queen
entries: You can place a corpse's hand or similar appendage on your Book of Shadows and ask one question aloud. After 1 minute, the answer appears written in blood in your book. The answer is provided by the dead creature's spirit to the best of its knowledge and is translated into a language of your choice. You must use this ability within 1 minute of a creature's death, and a given creature can only be asked one question in this manner.

optionalfeature.name: Claw of Acamar
entries: The reach of your pact weapon increases by 5 ft. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can force it to make an Intelligence {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. The DC equals 8 + {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} + your spellcasting ability + the weapon's enhancement bonus. On a failed save, the target's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is reduced to 0 and it cannot take {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir|Reactions} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Cloak of Flies
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can surround yourself with a magical aura that looks like buzzing flies. The aura extends 5 feet from you in every direction, but not through total cover. It lasts until you're {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} or you dismiss it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

The aura grants you {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} but {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on all other Charisma {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. Any other creature that starts or enters for the first time on its turn in the aura takes poison damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 0 damage).
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Curse Bringer
entries: The damage die of your pact weapon increases by one size. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can force it to make a Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. The DC equals 8 + {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} + your spellcasting ability + the weapon's enhancement bonus. On a failed save, the target is cursed until the start of your next turn. While the target is cursed, it has to roll a {@dice d4} every time it makes an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} and subtract the result from the total.

optionalfeature.name: Devil's Sight
entries: You can see normally in darkness and dim light, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Companion
entries: Your familiar takes on draconic features and changes its creature type to dragon if it wasn't already one. It has {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} against the damage type associated with your draconic patron. Additionally, its size increases to Medium.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, your familiar can exhale destructive energy in a 30 ft cone. Each creature in the area has to make a DEX {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your Spell Save DC. A target takes damage of the type associated with your patron equal to {@dice 2d6} + an additional {@dice 1d6} x your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} on a failed saved and half as much on a successful one.
Your familiar cannot use this action again until you have finished a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Scales
entries: You gain the benefits of {@variantrule Armor Mastery|Ishiir} for {@optfeature Unarmored Defense|Ishiir} and you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to the damage type associated with your draconic patron.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Spells
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for a spell you cast that deals damage of the type associated with your draconic patron, you can reroll the die. You must use the new roll, even if it is a 1 or 2.

Additionally, you can also replace any of the spells learned through your Mystic Arcana with a spell that deals damage of the type associated with your draconic patron and is of the same spell level as the spell replaced in this manner.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Wings
entries: You grow a pair of dragon wings and gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}. Any armor and clothing you want to don must accomodate them.

optionalfeature.name: Dreadful Word
entries: You can cast {@spell Confusion|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Armor
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch a suit of armor that isn't being worn or carried by anyone and instantly don it, provided you aren't wearing armor already. You are {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with this suit of armor until it's removed.
You also gain the benefits of the {@variantrule Armor Mastery|Ishiir} for this armor, as per the {@classFeature Martial Mastery|Barbarian|Ishiir|4|Ishiir} class feature.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Mind
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} that you make to maintain your {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Sight
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Smite
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can expend a warlock spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage to the target, plus another {@damage 1d8} per level of the spell slot, and you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition Prone|Ishiir}. The DC equals 8 + proficiency + your spellcasting ability + the weapon's enhancement bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Spear

otherSummary.entry: a Warlock cantrip that deals damage

entries: Choose one of your known Warlock cantrips that deals damage and has a range of 10+ feet. When you cast that spell, its range increases by a number of feet equal to 30 times your Warlock level.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can gain this invocation more than once. Each time you do so, choose a different eligible cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Rune Keeper
entries: You can read all writing.

optionalfeature.name: Far Scribe
entries: A new page appears in your Book of Shadows. With your permission, a creature can use its action to write its name on that page, which can contain a number of names equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus.

You can cast the {@spell Sending|Ishiir} spell, targeting a creature whose name is on the page, without using a spell slot and without using material components. To do so, you must write the message on the page. The target hears the message in their mind, and if the target replies, their message appears on the page, rather than in your mind. The writing disappears after 1 minute.
As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can magically erase a name on the page by touching it.

optionalfeature.name: Fiendish Vigor
entries: You can cast {@spell False Life|Ishiir} on yourself without expending a spell slot. When you cast the spell with this feature, you don't roll the die for the Temporary Hit Points; you automatically get the highest number on the die.

optionalfeature.name: Gaze of Two Minds
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to touch a willing creature and perceive through its senses until the end of your next turn. As long as the creature is on the same plane of existence as you, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on subsequent turns to maintain this connection, extending the duration until the end of your next turn. The connection ends if you don't maintain it in this way.

While perceiving through the other creature's senses, you benefit from any special senses possessed by that creature, and you can cast spells as if you were in your space or the other creature's space if the two of you are within 60 feet of each other.

optionalfeature.name: Ghostly Gaze
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you gain the ability to see through solid objects to a range of 30 feet. Within that range, you have {@sense darkvision} if you don't already have it. This special sight lasts for 1 minute or until your {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} ends (as if you were concentrating on a spell). During that time, you perceive objects as ghostly, transparent images.
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Depths
entries: You can breathe underwater, and you gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.
You can also cast {@spell Water Breathing|Ishiir} once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Ever-Living Ones
entries: Whenever you regain hit points while your familiar is within 100 feet of you, treat any dice rolled to determine the hit points you regain as having rolled their maximum value for you.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Protectors
entries: A new page appears in your Book of Shadows. With your permission, a creature can use its action to write its name on that page, which can contain a number of names equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus.

When any creature whose name is on the page is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, the creature magically drops to 1 hit point instead. Once this magic is triggered, no creature can benefit from it until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can magically erase a name on the page by touching it.

optionalfeature.name: Grasp of Hadar

otherSummary.entry: a Warlock cantrip that deals damage

entries: Choose one of your known Warlock cantrips that deals damage and has a range of 10+ feet. When you cast that spell, you can move that creature in a straight line 10 feet closer to you.

optionalfeature.name: Green Lord's Gift
entries: The Green Lord oversees a verdant realm of everlasting summer. Your soul is linked to his power. Whenever you regain hit points, you treat any dice rolled to determine the hit points you regain as having rolled their maximum value.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Pact Weapon
entries: You can use any weapon you summon with your Pact of the Blade feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.
In addition, the weapon gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, stacking with existing bonuses on the weapon, up to a maximum of +5 for the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Investment of the Chain Master
entries: When you cast {@spell Find Familiar|Ishiir}, you infuse the summoned familiar with a measure of your eldritch power, granting the creature the following benefits:

items: The familiar gains either a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} or a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} (your choice) of 40 feet.
The familiar's weapon attacks are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to nonmagical attacks.
If the familiar forces a creature to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, it uses your spell save DC.
When the familiar takes damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to grant it {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} against that damage.
You can replace your familiar's {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} bonus with your spell attack bonus if it is higher.
You can replace your familiar's hit point maximum with 5 x your Warlock level if it is higher.

optionalfeature.name: Kiss of Mephistopheles
entries: When you hit a creature with your {@spell Eldritch Blast|Ishiir}, you can cast {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} using a warlock spell slot. The spell must be centered on the creature you hit with {@spell Eldritch Blast|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Lance of Lethargy

otherSummary.entry: a Warlock cantrip that deals damage

entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a Warlock cantrip, you can reduce that creature's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Lifedrinker
entries: When you hit a creature with your pact weapon you can deal {@damage 1d8} extra damage to it. You choose the damage type when you select this invocation from the following options: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, psychic, or radiant. Once per turn, when you deal damage with this invocation, you regain a hit die. You can then choose to spend this hit die immediately, regaining hit points as if you had taken a rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mace of Dispater
entries: The damage die of your pact weapon increases by one size. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can force it to make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. The DC equals 8 + {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} + your spellcasting ability + the weapon's enhancement bonus. On a failed save, the target is {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Maddening Hex
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you cause a psychic disturbance around the target cursed by your {@spell Hex|Ishiir} spell or by a warlock feature of yours, such as Hexblade's Curse or Sign of Ill Omen. When you do so, you deal psychic damage to the cursed target and each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The psychic damage equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage). To use this invocation, you must be able to see the cursed target, and it must be within 30 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Resistance (EI)
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spells and other magical effects.

optionalfeature.name: Mask of Many Faces
entries: You can cast {@spell Disguise Self|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Myriad Forms
entries: You can cast {@spell Alter Self|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Minions of Chaos
entries: You can cast {@spell Conjure Elemental|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Mire the Mind
entries: You can cast {@spell Slow|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Misty Visions
entries: You can cast {@spell Silent Image|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Moon Bow
entries: The damage die of your pact weapon increases by one size. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can force it to make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. The DC equals 8 + {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} + your spellcasting ability + the weapon's enhancement bonus. On a failed save, the target sheds dim light in a 10-feet radius and cannot benefit from {@condition Invisible|Ishiir|invisibility} until the start of your next turn. During that time, all {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the target have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: One with Shadows
entries: When you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use your action to become {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} for 1 hour or until you attack, {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell}, or enter an area of bright light.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldly Leap
entries: You can cast {@spell Jump|Ishiir} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Blade
entries: You can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to create a pact weapon in your empty hand. You can choose the form that this weapon takes each time you create it (see chapter 5 for weapon options). You are {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with it while you wield it. This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to nonmagical attacks and damage.

Your pact weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required), or if you die.

You can transform one magic weapon into your pact weapon by performing a special ritual while you hold the weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}. You can then dismiss the weapon, shunting it into an extradimensional space, and it appears whenever you create your pact weapon thereafter. You can't affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon ceases being your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks.
You also gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in medium armor and shields.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Chain
entries: You learn the {@spell Find Familiar|Ishiir} spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

When you cast the spell, you can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, {@creature quasit}, or {@creature sprite}.

The familiar obeys your commands as best it can. It rolls for initiative like any other creature, but you determine its actions, decisions, attitudes, and so on. If you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} or absent, your familiar acts on its own.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Star Chain
entries: A character dedicated to the {@class Warlock|Ishiir|Seeker|Seeker|Ishiir} can select this option instead of one of the warlock's existing Pact Boon options.

The Seeker grants you a chain forged from starlight, decorated with seven gleaming motes of brightness. While the chain is on your person, you know the {@spell Augury|Ishiir} spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

Additionally, you can invoke the Seeker's power to gain {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on an Intelligence check while you carry this item. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

If you lose your Star Chain, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from the Seeker. The ceremony can be performed during a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, and it destroys the previous chain. The chain disappears in a flash of light when you die.
The exact form of this item might be different depending on your patron.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Talisman
entries: Your patron gives you an amulet, a talisman that can aid the wearer when the need is great. When the wearer fails an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, they can add a {@dice d4} to the roll, potentially turning the roll into a success. This benefit can be used a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

If you lose the talisman, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, and it destroys the previous amulet. The talisman turns to ash when you die.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Tome
entries: Your patron gives you a grimoire called a Book of Shadows. When you gain this feature, choose three {@filter cantrips|spells|level=0|source=Ishiir} from any class's spell list. The cantrips do not need to be from the same spell list. While the book is on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. They don't count against your number of cantrips known. Any cantrip you cast with this feature is considered a warlock cantrip for you. If you lose your Book of Shadows, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, and it destroys the previous book. The book turns to ash when you die.

optionalfeature.name: Path of the Seeker
entries: The Seeker bids you to travel in search of knowledge, and little can prevent you from walking this path. You ignore {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on all {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} to {@action Escape a Grapple|Ishiir}, manacles, or rope bindings, and {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against being {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Protection of the Talisman
entries: When the wearer of your talisman fails a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, they can add a {@dice d4} to the roll, potentially turning the save into a success. This benefit can be used a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Raven Queen's Blessing
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, you are automatically considered under the effect of the {@spell Death Ward|Ishiir} spell, but the duration lasts until you finish your next {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Rebuke of the Talisman
entries: When the wearer of your talisman is hit by an attacker you can see within 30 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to deal psychic damage to the attacker equal to half your Warlock level and push it up to 10 feet away from the talisman's wearer.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Hex
entries: Your curse creates a temporary bond between you and your target. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of the target cursed by your {@spell Hex|Ishiir} spell or by a warlock feature of yours, such as Hexblade's Curse or Sign of Ill Omen. To teleport in this way, you must be able to see the cursed target.

optionalfeature.name: Repelling Blast

otherSummary.entry: a Warlock cantrip that deals damage via an Attack Roll

entries: Choose one of your known Warlock cantrips that requires an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}. When you hit a Large or smaller creature with that cantrip, you can push the creature up to 10 feet straight away from you.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can gain this invocation more than once. Each time you do so, choose a different eligible cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Sculptor of Flesh
entries: You can cast {@spell Polymorph|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Seeker's Speech
entries: Your quest for knowledge allows you to master any spoken language. When you complete a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can pick two languages. You gain the ability to speak, read, and write the chosen languages until you finish your next {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Shroud of Shadow
entries: You can cast {@spell Invisibility|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Shroud of Ulban
entries: The blue-white star Ulban maintains a fickle presence among the stars, fluttering into view only to herald a dire omen. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can turn {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} for 1 minute. If you attack, deal damage, or force a creature to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you become visible at the end of the current turn.

optionalfeature.name: Sign of Ill Omen
entries: You can cast {@spell Bestow Curse|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Spellbound Blade
entries: You learn one of the following Cantrips: {@spell Booming Blade|Ishiir}, {@spell Greenflame Blade|Ishiir}, {@spell True Strike|Ishiir}. Once per turn, when you make a weapon attack, you can replace it with one of these cantrips.

optionalfeature.name: Superior Pact Weapon
entries: You can use any weapon you summon with your Pact of the Blade feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

In addition, the weapon gains a +2 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, stacking with existing bonuses on the weapon except other Pact Weapon invocations, up to a maximum of +5 for the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} bonus.

optionalfeature.name: The Master's Boon
entries: Choose two ability scores from Strength, your Spellcasting Ability, and Constitution. The chosen ability scores and their maximums increase by 2.
Additionally, your average life expectancy is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: The Master's Presence
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can exude your patron's frightening presence in a radius of 60 feet. Every creature of your choice in the area that is aware of you, must make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. On a failure, it is {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to your Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.
You cannot use this feature again until you have finished a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Thief of Five Fates
entries: You can cast {@spell Bane|Ishiir} once. You can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Thirsting Blade
entries: You can attack with your pact weapon twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Tomb of Levistus
entries: As a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} when you take damage, you can entomb yourself in ice, which melts away at the end of your next turn. You gain 10 temporary hit points per warlock level, which take as much of the triggering damage as possible. Immediately after you take the damage, you gain vulnerability to fire damage, your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is reduced to 0, and you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. These effects, including any remaining temporary hit points, all end when the ice melts.
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Trickster's Escape
entries: You can cast {@spell Freedom of Movement|Ishiir} once on yourself without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Ultimate Pact Weapon
entries: You can use any weapon you summon with your Pact of the Blade feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

In addition, the weapon gains a +3 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, stacking with existing bonuses on the weapon except other Pact Weapon invocations, up to a maximum of +5 for the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Undying Servitude
entries: You can cast {@spell Animate Dead|Ishiir} without using a spell slot. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Visions of Distant Realms
entries: You can cast {@spell Arcane Eye|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Voice of the Chain Master
entries: You can communicate telepathically with your familiar and perceive through your familiar's senses as long as you are on the same plane of existence. Additionally, while perceiving through your familiar's senses, you can also speak through your familiar in your own voice, even if your familiar is normally incapable of speech.

optionalfeature.name: Whispers of the Grave
entries: You can cast {@spell Speak with Dead|Ishiir} at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Witch Sight
entries: You have {@sense Truesight} with a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Aquatic Odem
entries: You can spend 3 kinesis points to cast {@spell Water Breathing|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Blade Whirlwind
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can spend 2 kinesis points and make a melee attack against any number of creatures in range of your kinetic blade.

optionalfeature.name: Blazing Agony
entries: You can spend 5 kinesis points to cast {@spell Immolation|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Blinding Infusion

otherSummary.entry: Air or Fire Element; Kinetic Shape Effect

entries: When you hit a creature with your kinetic shape, you can spend 1 kinesis point to force it to make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your save DC. On a failure, the creature is {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} for 1 minute.
At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Bowling Infusion

otherSummary.entry: Air, Earth, or Water Element; Kinetic Shape Effect

entries: When you damage a creature with your kinetic shape, you can force it to make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your save DC. On a failure, the creature is knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Breath of the Sky
entries: You can cast {@spell Gust of Wind|Ishiir} at-will, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Infusion
entries: When you damage a creature with your kinetic shape, you can force it to make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your save DC. On a failure, the target is set ablaze, burning for fire damage equal to double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} modifier at the start of each of its turns.

It can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Alternatively, it or another creature can use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to douse the flames.

optionalfeature.name: Call of Gravity
entries: You can spend 2 kinesis points to cast {@spell Earthbind|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Call the Flood
entries: You can spend 8 kinesis points to cast {@spell Tsunami|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Chain Infusion
entries: When you damage a creature with your kinetic shape, you can spend 3 kinesis points to make another attack with your kinetic blast against a different creature within 60 feet of your original target. The damage of your kinetic blast is halved for this attack.

If the attack hits, you can choose to spend 1 kinesis point to target another creature within 30 feet of your second target, which cannot be your original target. You roll the attack as you did before, and halve your kinetic blast damage.
You can repeat this as long as your attacks hit, you have new targets in range to chain to, and kinesis points to spend.

optionalfeature.name: Chilling Infusion
entries: When you damage a creature with your kinetic blast, you can force it to make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your save DC. On a failure, the creature's next {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} before the end of its next turn is made with {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Command the Heavens
entries: You can spend 8 kinesis points to cast {@spell Control Weather|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Earth Shaper
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Move Earth|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Earthen Grip
entries: You can cast {@spell Maximilian's Earthen Grasp|Ishiir} at-will, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Embrace of the Earth
