entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Stoneskin|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Entangling Infusion

otherSummary.entry: Earth or Water Element; Kinetic Shape Effect

entries: When you damage a creature with your kinetic shape, you can spend 1 kinesis point to force it to make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your save DC. On a failure, the creature is {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} for 1 minute.
At the end of each of its turns, the creature can make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Eruption

otherSummary.entry: Fire Element; Kinetic Shape Modification, Kinetic Blast shape

entries: By spending an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and 2 kinesis points, you can cause the energy of your kinetic shape to explode outward in a 10-foot radius cylinder that is 40 feet high.
Every creature in the area of effect has to make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your save DC, taking your kinetic shape damage on a failure, and half as much on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Fan of Flames
entries: By spending an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and 1 kinesis point, you can cause the energy of your kinetic shape to fan outward in a 30-foot cone. Every creature in the area of effect has to make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your save DC, taking your kinetic shape damage on a failure, and half as much on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Foxfire Infusion
entries: You can spend 1 kinesis points to cast {@spell Faerie Fire|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Fury of the Earth
entries: You can spend 8 kinesis points to cast {@spell Earthquake|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Water
entries: You can cast {@spell Create Or Destroy Water|Ishiir} at-will, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Ground Stomp
entries: You can cast {@spell Earth Tremor|Ishiir} at-will, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Herald of Storms
entries: You can spend 7 kinesis points to cast {@spell Whirlwind|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Hungry Vortex
entries: You can spend 5 kinesis points to cast {@spell Maelstrom|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Immortal Flame
entries: You can cast {@spell Continual Flame|Ishiir} at-will, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Imprisoning Rock
entries: You can spend 6 kinesis points to cast {@spell Flesh  to Stone|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Incinerate
entries: You can spend 6 kinesis points to cast {@spell Disintegrate|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Kinetic Healer
entries: You gain the ability to harness the cleansing properties of water.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can touch a creature and spend a number of kinesis points up to the current total you possess and heal the creature. For each kinesis point you spend the creature is healed for {@dice 2d8} hitpoints. You can also spend 2 kinesis points to remove any one poison or disease from the creature as part of the same action.

optionalfeature.name: Kinetic Whip
entries: The reach of your kinetic blade doubles. Additionally, creatures provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|Ishiir|Opportunity Attacks} from you if they move at least 5 ft within your reach.

optionalfeature.name: One with the Earth
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Meld into Stone|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Skywalker
entries: You can spend 6 kinesis points to cast {@spell Wind Walk|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Spindle Infusion
entries: By spending an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and 1 kinesis point, you can cause the energy of your kinetic shape to shootward in a 10-feet long, 5-feet wide spindle that travels 60 feet away from you until it disperses.
All creatures through whose spaces the spindle passes have to make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking your kinetic shape damage on failure, and half as much on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Under a Scarlet Sky
entries: You can spend 7 kinesis points to cast {@spell Fire Storm|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Walk on Water
entries: You can cast {@spell Water Walk|Ishiir} at-will, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Wall Infusion

otherSummary.entry: None; Kinetic Shape modification, Kinetic Blast shape

entries: By spending an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} and 3 kinesis points, you can use your kinetic shape to create a wall of churning elements, flensing debris, or roiling energy that lasts for 1 minute or until your {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} ends (as if concentrating on a spell). You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes half your kinetic shape's damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.
A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

optionalfeature.name: Water Shaper
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Control Water|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Watery Prison
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Watery Sphere|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Wind Shaper
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Control Winds|Ishiir}, but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Wreath of Flames
entries: You can spend 4 kinesis points to cast {@spell Fire Shield|Ishiir} (warm shield), but using only a somatic component.

optionalfeature.name: Superior Technique
entries: You learn one {@filter maneuver|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV:B|source=Ishiir} of your choice from among those available to the {@class fighter|Ishiir|Battle Master|Battle Master|Ishiir|2-0} archetype. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} to resist the maneuver's effects, the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DC equals 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

You gain one superiority die, which is a {@dice d6} (this die is added to any superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Unarmed Fighting
entries: Your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir|Unarmed Strikes} can deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier on a hit. If you aren't wielding any weapons or a {@item shield|phb} when you make the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, the {@damage d6} becomes a {@damage d8}.
At the start of each of your turns, you can deal {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage to one creature {@condition Grappled|Ishiir} by you.

optionalfeature.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

optionalfeature.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

optionalfeature.name: Interception
entries: When a creature you can see hits a target, other than you, within 5 feet of you with an attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to reduce the damage the target takes by {@dice 1d10} + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a {@item shield|phb} or a {@filter simple or martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;simple weapon} to use this {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Protection
entries: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}. You must be wielding a shield.

optionalfeature.name: Blind Fighting
entries: You have {@sense blindsight} with a range of 10 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're {@condition Blinded|Ishiir} or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

optionalfeature.name: Close Quarters Shooter
entries: When making a ranged weapon attack while you are within 5 feet of a hostile creature, you do not have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}. Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover against targets within 30 feet of you. You have a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} on ranged weapon attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Defense
entries: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Mariner
entries: As long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a shield, you have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} and a {@variantrule Climb Speed|Ishiir} equal to your normal {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, and you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} you make with ranged weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: You can draw a weapon that has the thrown property as part of the attack you make with the weapon.
In addition, when you hit with a ranged attack using a thrown weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Blessed Warrior
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter cleric spell list|spells|level=0|class=Cleric (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}. They count as paladin spells for you, and Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the cleric spell list.

optionalfeature.name: Druidic Warrior
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter druid spell list|spells|level=0|class=druid (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}. They count as ranger spells for you, and Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the druid spell list.

optionalfeature.name: Aether
entries: You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} for 1 hour. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on strength {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and Dexterity {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} during this time.

optionalfeature.name: Alluring
entries: Your skin and voice become malleable, allowing you to enhance your appearance and presence. You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Charisma {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on STR {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

optionalfeature.name: Black Blood
entries: If a creature within 5 feet of you deals piercing or slashing to you, it takes acid damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} and it cannot regain hit points until the start of its next turn. However, all healing you receive is halved.

optionalfeature.name: Breath
entries: You can breathe underwater and gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|Ishiir} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}, but you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on initiative rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Celerity
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 4, as does your maximum for that score. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

optionalfeature.name: Conversant
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Intelligence {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

optionalfeature.name: Cruelty
entries: When you use the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action, you can make one additional weapon attack as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

optionalfeature.name: Deftness
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

optionalfeature.name: Earthed
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to lightning damage, and you have vulnerability to acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Embers
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage and vulnerability to cold damage.

optionalfeature.name: Gelid
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold damage and vulnerability to fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Impermeable
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to piercing damage and vulnerability to slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mobility
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to the {@condition Grappled|Ishiir} and {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} conditions. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}. At 11th level, you are also {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to the {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Nighteye
entries: You have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, its range increases by 60 feet. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

optionalfeature.name: Percipient
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Charisma {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

optionalfeature.name: Potency
entries: Your Strength score increases by 4, as does your maximum for that score. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

optionalfeature.name: Precision
entries: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

optionalfeature.name: Rapidity
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 10 feet. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Intelligence {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}. At 15th level, your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by an additional 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Reconstruction
entries: For 1 hour, at the start of each of your turns when you have at least 1 hit point, you regain hit points equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus. However, your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is reduced by 10 feet during this time.

optionalfeature.name: Sagacity
entries: Your Intelligence or Wisdom score increases by 4, as does your maximum for that score. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

optionalfeature.name: Saturated
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to acid damage, and you have vulnerability to lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Shielded
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to slashing damage, and you have vulnerability to bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Unbreakable
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to bludgeoning damage, and you have vulnerability to piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Vermillion
entries: You gain an additional use of your Blood Maledict feature. However, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on death {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

optionalfeature.name: Careful Kinesis
entries: When you use your kinetic shape with an infusion that forces other creatures to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can protect some of those creatures from the shape's full force. To do so, you spend 1 kinesis point and choose a number of those creatures up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). A chosen creature automatically succeeds on its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against the blast and takes no damage if it would normally take half damage on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Distant Kinesis
entries: When you use a kinetic shape, you can spend 1 kinesis point to double its range.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Kinesis
entries: When you roll damage for your kinetic shape, you can spend 1 kinesis point to reroll a number of the damage dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). You must use the new rolls.
You can use Empowered Kinesis even if you have already used a different Metakinesis option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Kinesis
entries: When you use your kinetic shape with an infusion that makes it last more than 1 round, you can spend 1 kinesis point to double its duration, to a maximum duration of 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Heightened Kinesis
entries: When you use your kinetic shape with an infusion that forces a creature to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} to resist its effects, you can spend 2 kinesis points to give one target of the shape {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on all its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} made against the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Twinned Kinesis
entries: When you use your kinetic shape with an infusion that doesn't have a range of self and is incapable of targeting more than one creature, you can spend 3 kinesis points to have it target a second creature within range as well.

optionalfeature.name: Careful Spell
entries: When you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that forces other creatures to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can protect some of those creatures from the spell's full force. To do so, you spend 1 sorcery point and choose a number of those creatures up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Distant Spell
entries: When you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can spend 1 sorcery point to double the range of the spell.
When you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that has a range of touch, you can spend 1 sorcery point to make the range of the spell 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Spell
entries: When you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll a number of the damage dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). You must use the new rolls.
You can use Empowered Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Spell
entries: When you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can spend 1 sorcery point to double its duration, to a maximum duration of 24 hours.

If the affected spell requires {@condition Concentration|Ishiir}, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on any {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} you make to maintain that {@condition Concentration|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Heightened Spell
entries: When you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that forces a creature to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} to resist its effects, you can spend 2 sorcery points to give one target of the spell {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on all its {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} made against the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Maximized Spell
entries: When you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 2 sorcery points and choose a number damage dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). You maximize the rolled result for the chosen dice.
You can use Maximized Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Quickened Spell
entries: When you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that has a casting time of an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to change the casting time to a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} for this casting. You can't modify a spell in this way if you've already cast a level 1+ spell on the current turn, nor can you cast a level 1+ spell on this turn after modifying a spell in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Spell
entries: If you make an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} for a spell and miss, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll the {@dice d20}, and you must use the new roll.
You can use Seeking Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Subtle Spell
entries: When you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell}, you can spend 1 sorcery point to cast it without any somatic, verbal and material components, unless that material component has a cost or is consumed by the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Twinned Spell
entries: When you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

To be eligible, a spell must be incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spell's current level. For example, {@spell Magic Missile|Ishiir} and {@spell Scorching Ray|Ishiir} aren't eligible, but {@spell Ray of Frost|Ishiir} and {@spell Chromatic Orb|Ishiir} are.

optionalfeature.name: Ambush
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check or an initiative roll, you can expend one superiority die and add the die to the roll, provided you aren't {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Bait and Switch
entries: When you're within 5 feet of a creature on your turn, you can expend one superiority die and switch places with that creature, provided you spend at least 5 feet of movement and the creature is willing and isn't {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. This movement doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|Ishiir|Opportunity Attacks}.
Roll the superiority die. Until the start of your next turn, you or the other creature (your choice) gains a bonus to AC equal to the number rolled.

optionalfeature.name: Brace
entries: When a creature you can see moves into the reach you have with the melee weapon you're wielding, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend one superiority die and make one attack against the creature, using that weapon. If the attack hits, add the superiority die to the weapon's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Commander's Strike
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks to direct one of your companions to strike. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you and expend one superiority die. That creature can immediately use its {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to make one weapon attack, adding the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Commanding Presence
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}), a Charisma ({@skill Performance}), or a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, you can expend one superiority die and add the superiority die to the {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Disarming Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to disarm the target, forcing it to drop one item of your choice that it's holding. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, it drops the object you choose. The object lands at its feet.

optionalfeature.name: Distracting Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to distract the creature, giving your allies an opening. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll. The next {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against the target by an attacker other than you has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} if the attack is made before the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Evasive Footwork
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend one Superiority Die and take the {@action Disengage|Ishiir} action. You also roll the die and add the number rolled to your AC until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Feinting Attack
entries: You can expend one superiority die and use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your turn to feint, choosing one creature within 5 feet of you as your target. You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on your next {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against that creature this turn. If that attack hits, add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Goading Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to goad the target into attacking you. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on all {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against targets other than you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Grappling Strike
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee attack on your turn, you can expend one superiority die and then try to grapple the target as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} (see the Player's Handbook for rules on grappling). Add the superiority die to your Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check.

optionalfeature.name: Lunging Attack
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend one Superiority Die and take the {@action Dash|Ishiir} action. If you move at least 5 feet in a straight line immediately before hitting with a melee attack as part of the Attack action on this turn, you can add the Superiority Die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Maneuvering Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to maneuver one of your comrades into a more advantageous position. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and you choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you. That creature can use its {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|Ishiir|Opportunity Attacks} from the target of your attack.

optionalfeature.name: Menacing Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to frighten the target. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, it is {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} of you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Parry
entries: When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} and expend one superiority die to reduce the damage by the number you roll on your superiority die + STR or DEX modifier (your choice) + fighter level.

optionalfeature.name: Precision Attack
entries: When you miss with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can expend one Superiority Die, roll that die, and add it to the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, potentially causing the attack to hit.

optionalfeature.name: Pushing Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to drive the target back. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, you push the target up to 15 feet away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Toss
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend one superiority die and make a ranged attack with a weapon that has the thrown property. You can draw the weapon as part of making this attack. If you hit, add the superiority die to the weapon's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Rally
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend one Superiority Die to bolster the resolve of a companion. Choose an ally of yours within 30 feet of yourself who can see or hear you. That creature gains Temporary Hit Points equal to the Superiority Die roll plus half your Fighter level (round down).

optionalfeature.name: Restraining Strike
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can expend one superiority die and use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to grapple the target (see chapter 9 in the Player's Handbook for rules on grappling). Add the superiority die to your Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. The target is also {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} while {@condition Grappled|Ishiir} in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} and expend one superiority die to make a melee weapon attack against the creature. If you hit, you add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Silver Tongue
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check or a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, you can expend one superiority die, and add the superiority die to the {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Snipe
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend one superiority die and make a ranged weapon attack. You can draw a thrown weapon as part of making this attack. If you hit, add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Staggering Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock a target off-balance. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the target cannot take {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir|Reactions} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Studious Eye
entries: When you make a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check or an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check, you can expend one superiority die, and add the superiority die to the {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Sweeping Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to damage another creature with the same attack. Choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. If the original {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to the number you roll on your superiority die. The damage is of the same type dealt by the original attack.

optionalfeature.name: Tactical Assessment
entries: When you make an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}), an Intelligence ({@skill History}), or a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check, you can expend one superiority die and add the superiority die to the {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Trip Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock the target down. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failed save, you knock the target {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Absorption
entries: When you {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} that deals damage to the named target, you gain {@dice 3d6} temporary hit points. The number of temporary hit points you gain increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 10th level ({@dice 4d6}) and 14th level ({@dice 5d6}) in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Devastation
entries: If the spell requires the named creature to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, that creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the first save it makes against the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Dissolution
entries: The first time the named creature takes damage from the spell, that creature takes an extra {@damage 2d8} force damage. The extra force damage increases by {@damage 1d8} when you reach 10th level ({@damage 3d8}) and 14th level ({@damage 4d8}) in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Nullification
entries: If the named target is affected by any other spells, you know what those spells are, and you can attempt to end one of your choice by succeeding on an Intelligence check with a DC equal to 10 + the level of the chosen spell.

optionalfeature.name: Puppetry
entries: The first time the named creature takes damage from the spell, you can knock the creature {@condition Prone|Ishiir} or move it up to 10 feet, either directly toward you or away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Sympathy
entries: If the named creature is within range of the spell, you can target the creature with the spell even if you can't see the creature or it has total cover against the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Cloud Rune
entries: This rune emulates the deceptive magic used by some cloud giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and Charisma ({@skill Deception}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

In addition, when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is hit by an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to invoke the rune and choose a different creature within 30 feet of you, other than the attacker. The chosen creature becomes the target of the attack, using the same roll. This magic can transfer the attack's effects regardless of the attack's range. Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Rune
entries: This rune's magic channels the masterful craftsmanship of great smiths. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus is doubled for any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} you make that uses your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with a tool.

In addition, when you hit a creature with an attack using a weapon, you can invoke the rune to summon fiery shackles: the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} fire damage, and it must succeed on a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or be {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} for 1 minute. While {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} by the shackles, the target takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, banishing the shackles on a success. Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Frost Rune
entries: This rune's magic evokes the might of those who survive in the wintry wilderness, such as frost giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

In addition, you can invoke the rune as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to increase your sturdiness. For 10 minutes, you gain a +2 bonus to all {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} that use Strength or Constitution. Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Hill Rune
entries: This rune's magic bestows a resilience reminiscent of a hill giant. While wearing or carrying an object that bears this rune, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against being {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}, and you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} against poison damage.

In addition, you can invoke the rune as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, gaining {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute. Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Rune
entries: This rune's magic channels the judiciousness associated with stone giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}, and you have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 120 feet.

In addition, when a creature you can see ends its turn within 30 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to invoke the rune and force the creature to make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. Unless the save succeeds, the creature is {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} by you for 1 minute. While {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} in this way, the creature has a {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} of 0 and is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, descending into a dreamy stupor. The creature repeats the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Storm Rune
entries: Using this rune, you can glimpse the future like a storm giant seer. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}, and you can't be {@condition Surprised|Ishiir} as long as you aren't {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}.

In addition, you can invoke the rune as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to enter a prophetic state for 1 minute or until you're {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. Until the state ends, when you or another creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, or an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to cause the roll to have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}. Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Cleave
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can also deal damage equal to your STR or DEX (your choice) to any other creature that is within range of your attack and within 5 ft of the original target, provided that your {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} would've also hit these targets. This damage is doubled if the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} was a critical hit.
If the attack reduced the original target to 0 hitpoints, you instead deal your full weapon damage to one of the additional targets.

optionalfeature.name: Flurry
entries: When you use two-weapon fighting and both of your weapons have this mastery, you can make the extra attack of your off-hand weapon as part of the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action rather than as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. If you do so, you can't use any other mastery with the attacks that are part of this {@action Attack|Ishiir} action.

optionalfeature.name: Gash
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force it to make a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} at the start of its next turn for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns it can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Lunge
entries: When you attack with this weapon, you can increase its range by 5 feet. You can also use this mastery to increase the reach of your weapon for the purposes of satisfying trigger conditions of melee attacks you can make as a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}, e.g. {@action Opportunity Attack|Ishiir|Opportunity Attacks} or the Battle Master's brace maneuver.

optionalfeature.name: Pierce
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d4} and it add it to the next weapon attack you make against it before the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Push
entries: When you hit a creature that is no more than 1 size category larger than you with this weapon, you can force it to make a STR {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or move it 5 ft in a direction you choose.

optionalfeature.name: Sap
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force it to make a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, it must roll a {@dice d4} when it next makes an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} (your choice) and subtract the result from the total.

optionalfeature.name: Slow
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force it to make a CON {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or halve its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} until beginning of your next turn.
